newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico says maquiladora output up 14.2 pct in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Mexico says maquiladora output up 14.2 pct in Q1.

text.p: Mexico's maquiladora production rose by 14.2 percent in real terms in the first three months of the year, compared with the same time period in 1996, the National Statistics Institute (INEGI) said on Wednesday.
The maquiladora or in-bond industry is comprised of assembly plants mostly along the U.S. border.
INEGI said in a statement that rent and energy costs in the industry rose by 27.7 percent and the cost of packaging and basic materials rose by 9.6 percent in the time period.
The institute determines the value added by the maquiladora assembly plants by calculating the difference between the cost of basic goods and the finished product.
Employment in the industry rose 19.4 percent in the first quarter compared with the year before, INEGI said.
Hours worked rose by 14.9 percent in the first three months compared with 1996, it said.
